qas.question: Where has transnational policing become more important?
What kind of countries get assistance with policing?
Who wrote about police development-aid in 2007?
What concern did Hills raise about police models?

answers.text: there are questions about the applicability and transportability of policing models between jurisdictions

qas.question: What concern did Hills raise about power imbalances?

answers.text: With transnational police development-aid the imbalances of power between donors and recipients are stark

qas.question: Where has transnational policing become less important?
What kind of countries get no assistance with policing?
Who wrote about police development-aid in 2006?

plausible_answers.text: there are questions about the applicability and transportability of policing models between jurisdictions

qas.question: What concern did Hills ignore about police models?

plausible_answers.text: With transnational police development-aid the imbalances of power between donors and recipients are stark

qas.question: What concern did Hills ignore about power imbalances?

context: Police development-aid to <a1_0><b6_0>weak, failed or failing states<b6_0/><a1_0/> is another form of transnational policing that has garnered attention. This form of transnational policing plays an increasingly important role <a0_0><b5_0>in United Nations peacekeeping<b5_0/><a0_0/> and this looks set to grow in the years ahead, especially as the international community seeks to develop the rule of law and reform security institutions in States recovering from conflict (<a2_0><b7_0>Goldsmith and Sheptycki<b7_0/><a2_0/>, 2007) <a4_0><b9_0>With transnational police development-aid the imbalances of power between donors and recipients are stark<b9_0/><a4_0/> and <a3_0><b8_0>there are questions about the applicability and transportability of policing models between jurisdictions<b8_0/><a3_0/> (Hills, 2009).
